newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb on depreciation.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends down in kerb on depreciation.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.04 down at 41.50 to the dollar in the kerb market on Friday on a lower adjustment by the central bank, dealers said.
The rupee is likely to open stable on Saturday, one dealer said.
The State (central) bank of Pakistan depreciated the rupee to 40.3900/40.5920 against the dollar on Friday from 40.3300/40.5317 fixed on May 6.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 2.60 percent compared to the opening at 2.70 percent.
